intro: Funastrum barbatum, commonly known as the hairy funastrum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
